
= Workplace for Very Fine Resolution (VFR) modellers =

This site is intended for communication between VFR  (very fine resolution, in horizontal below one kilometre) modellers in HIRLAM and ALADIN consortia, using ALADIN nonhydrostatic dynamics. Please feel free to edit and add attachements and links.

for NH dynamics in horizontal resolutions under 1km \\
(first draft from 17 Oct 2013)

|| Feature || Method || Namelist variables || Namelist set ||Possible alternatives || Suggtested for testing ||
|| NH dynamics || || LNHDYN=T \\ NDLNPR=1 || || || ||
|| Prognostic variables || qhat = ln(p/pi) \\ d4 in spectral space \\ w in GP space || \
|| NPDVAR=2 \\ NVDVAR=4 \\ LGWADV=T || || ||  ||
|| Time scheme || 2TL SL \\ \\ Predictor-corrector scheme: \\ PC NESC non-extrapolating \\ in the predictor step \\ \\ \\ Number of iterations: \\ For trajectory calculations: || \
|| LTWOTL=T \\ LSLAG=T \\  LSETTLS=F \\ LPC_OLD=F \\ LPC_CHEAP=F \\ LPC_FULL=T \\ LPC_NESC=T \\ NSITER=1 \\ LPC_NESCT=T ||  [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/harmonie/src/arp/setup/suct0.F90 &NAMCT0] \\ [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/harmonie/src/arp/setup/suct0.F90 &NAMCT0] \\ [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/harmonie/src/arp/setup/sudyn.F90 &NAMDYN]\\ [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/harmonie/src/arp/setup/suct0.F90 &NAMCT0]\\ [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/harmonie/src/arp/setup/suct0.F90 &NAMCT0]\\ [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/harmonie/src/arp/setup/suct0.F90 &NAMCT0]\\ [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/harmonie/src/arp/setup/suct0.F90 &NAMCT0]\\ [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/harmonie/src/arp/setup/sudyn.F90 &NAMDYN]\\ [https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/harmonie/src/arp/setup/suct0.F90 &NAMCT0]|| LPC_CHEAP=T || \\  \\  LSETTLS=T \\ \\ LPC_CHEAP=F \\ LPC_FULL=F \\ LPC_NESC=F \\ NSITER=0 \\ LPC_NESCT=F  ||
|| Boundary conditions \\ \\ || Kinematic BBC along SL trajectory  \\ \\ Upper boundary nesting || not needed for w in GP space \\ LRDBBC=F \\ || ||LRDBBC=T \\ LGWADV=F \\ || \\ \\ LUNBC=T ||
|| SI background || 2 reference temperatures \\ SITRA < T < SITR \\ small SIPR || || \
|| SITRA=50. \\ SITR=300. \\ SIPR=80000. || || \\SITR=350 \\ ||

Several other features which have to be carefully chosen: \\
  - timestep used \\
  - distribution of vertical levels (especially near the model top) \\
  - coupling frequency, coupling zone size \\
  - physiographic fields resolution \\
  - numerical diffusion (SLHD)

This is the link to HARMONIE perl module setting namelists: https://hirlam.org/trac/browser/trunk/harmonie/nam/harmonie_namelists.pm
